instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]3208 found pulled pad, tons of connections, am I effed?
threads.message: Working on a 3208. Found a broken off resistor (R5250), and ripped up pad (1). There are hundreds of things running to this one spot. Am I fucked? Could I bypass the location somehow by tying in somewhere else?

threads.title: [SOLVED]3208 found pulled pad, tons of connections, am I effed?
threads.message: if pad 2 is sitll there, just jump it to pin 1 of r5251

threads.title: [SOLVED]3208 found pulled pad, tons of connections, am I effed?
threads.message: It simply goes to the power bus and a wire to any point where that is present will work. Also this resistor will not prevent the board from working.

threads.title: [SOLVED]3208 found pulled pad, tons of connections, am I effed?
threads.message: Got it, conformal coated the jumper, all is well. Thanks!
